subject: Re: [junit] JUnit testing of servlet and HTTP servlet requests
msgSnippet: ... I would just add j2ee.jar and be done with it. At least that s what JBoss provides me. I confess I don t remember the details anymore, since I haven t done
messageBody:
Pat Farrell wrote:
>
>
> Lasse Koskela wrote:
> > The NoClassDefError indicates there's
> > something flaky about your "test" class path. I don't know anything
> > about NetBeans, though, so I cannot really provide any concrete help
> > there.
>
> Yes, of course the javax.servlet classes are missing.
> NetBeans includes tomcat, so that is the "container" that resolves the
> classes when executing.
>
> Its not clear, at least to me, which .jar file includes them. If I knew
> that, I could add them to the library path for testing.

I would just add j2ee.jar and be done with it. At least that's what
JBoss provides me. I confess I don't remember the details anymore, since
I haven't done serious J2EE work in at least three years.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
